name: HD 106252
scenarioDescription:
The HD 106252 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 106252 is a star with 1.01 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.1 times its radius. It is located 124.69 light years away from the solar system.

HD 106252 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 106252 system


HD 106252 b

HD 106252 b was discovered by the Lick Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.61 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 106252 b is 2203.74 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 106252 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 106252, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Lick Observatory.
